alert.note: Alert for Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 4:21AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...High Water In The Noatak And Kobuk River Valleys... The Kobuk and Noatak Valleys have had up to 4 inches of rain so far this week with up to 2 more inches of rain expected through Saturday morning. This is producing a sharp rises on all rivers in the Noatak and Kobuk Basins and that will continue through the weekend. Large rivers such as the Kobuk and Noatak are not expected to flood, but smaller rivers and creeks could reach bankfull. The high water will cause many logs and other debris to float down the rivers. People traveling and recreating on rivers and streams draining the Noatak and Kobuk Valleys are encouraged to monitor water levels since some exposed gravel bars could become inundated due to runoff from the rainfall. For the latest weather forecasts go to www.weather.gov/fairbanks, and for the latest river forecasts go to www.weather.gov/aprfc.

area.areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys
